segments.en: Linked Discourses 35
13. Householders
130. With Hāliddikāni

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahākaccāno avantīsu viharati kuraraghare papāte pabbate.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying in the land of the Avantis near Kuraraghara on Steep Mountain.

segments.pli: Atha kho hāliddikāni gahapati yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho hāliddikāni gahapati āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the householder Hāliddikāni went up to Venerable Mahākaccāna … and asked him,
“Sir, this was said by the Buddha:

segments.pli: ‘dhātunānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṃ; phassanānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan’ti.
segments.en: ‘Diversity of elements gives rise to diversity of contacts, and diversity of contacts gives rise to diversity of feelings.’

segments.pli: Kathaṃ nu kho, bhante, dhātunānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṃ; phassanānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan”ti?
segments.en: How does diversity of elements give rise to diversity of contacts, and diversity of contacts gives rise to diversity of feelings?”

segments.pli: “Idha, gahapati, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā ‘manāpaṃ itthetan’ti pajānāti cakkhuviññāṇaṃ sukhavedaniyañca.
segments.en: “Householder, it’s when a mendicant sees a sight and understands it to be agreeable.
There is eye consciousness; and pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.

segments.pli: Cakkhunā kho paneva rūpaṃ disvā ‘amanāpaṃ itthetan’ti pajānāti cakkhuviññāṇaṃ dukkhavedaniyañca.
segments.en: Then they see a sight and understand it to be disagreeable.
There is eye consciousness; and painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.

segments.pli: Cakkhunā kho paneva rūpaṃ disvā ‘upekkhāṭṭhāniyaṃ itthetan’ti pajānāti cakkhuviññāṇaṃ adukkhamasukhavedaniyañca.
segments.en: Then they see a sight and understand it to be a basis for equanimity.
There is eye consciousness; and neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, gahapati, bhikkhu sotena saddaṃ sutvā … pe …
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant hears a sound with the ear …
smells an odor with the nose …
tastes a flavor with the tongue …
feels a touch with the body …

segments.pli: manasā dhammaṃ viññāya ‘manāpaṃ itthetan’ti pajānāti manoviññāṇaṃ sukhavedaniyañca.
segments.en: knows a thought with the mind and understands it to be agreeable.
There is mind consciousness; and pleasant feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as pleasant.

segments.pli: Manasā kho paneva dhammaṃ viññāya ‘amanāpaṃ itthetan’ti pajānāti manoviññāṇaṃ dukkhavedaniyañca.
segments.en: Then they know a thought and understand it to be disagreeable.
There is mind consciousness; and painful feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as painful.

segments.pli: Manasā kho paneva dhammaṃ viññāya ‘upekkhāṭṭhāniyaṃ itthetan’ti pajānāti manoviññāṇaṃ adukkhamasukhavedaniyañca.
segments.en: Then they know a thought and understand it to be a basis for equanimity.
Neutral feeling arises dependent on a contact to be experienced as neutral.

segments.pli: Evaṃ kho, gahapati, dhātunānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati phassanānattaṃ; phassanānattaṃ paṭicca uppajjati vedanānānattan”ti.
segments.en: That’s how diversity of elements gives rise to diversity of contacts, and diversity of contacts gives rise to diversity of feelings.”

suttaplex.blurb: The householder Hāliddakāni asks Mahākaccāna about the relation between the diversity of elements and the diveristy of contacts, and he answers in terms of the elements of sense experience.
